Evaluation (admet.evaluate)¶

The admet.evaluate package contains metric definitions and evaluation utilities. It provides standard ADMET metrics like RMSE, MAE, R², Pearson r, Spearman ρ, and Kendall τ to assess model performance, as well as helpers for ensemble evaluation and metric aggregation.

Metrics and split-level evaluation¶

Metric computations for multi-output regression with masking.

Supports log-space and linear-space evaluation (10^x for non-LogD endpoints).

Contents¶

Functions

compute_metrics : Per-endpoint and macro metrics in native (log) space. compute_metrics_log_and_linear : Combined log + linear space metrics.

Types

EndpointMetrics : TypedDict of per-endpoint metric values. SplitMetrics : Mapping endpoint -> metrics plus macro aggregate. EndpointSpaceMetrics : Mapping metric space -> per-endpoint metrics. AllMetrics : Full run-level structure across splits and spaces.

class admet.evaluate.metrics.EndpointMetrics[source]¶

Bases: TypedDict

R2: float¶
kendall_tau: float¶
mae: float¶
pearson_r2: float¶
rmse: float¶
spearman_rho2: float¶
admet.evaluate.metrics.compute_metrics(y_true, y_pred, mask, endpoints)[source]¶

Compute per-endpoint metrics (log space) and macro averages.

Parameters:

  • y_true (np.ndarray) – True target values with shape (n_samples, n_endpoints).

  • y_pred (np.ndarray) – Predicted target values with same shape as y_true.

  • mask (np.ndarray) – Integer or boolean mask where non-zero / True indicates a valid observation per endpoint.

  • endpoints (Sequence[str]) – Ordered list of endpoint names corresponding to columns in arrays.

Returns:

Mapping from endpoint name to metric dict plus a “macro” aggregate.

Return type:

SplitMetrics

admet.evaluate.metrics.compute_metrics_log_and_linear(y_true, y_pred, mask, endpoints)[source]¶

Compute metrics in both log space and linear space.

Parameters:

  • y_true (np.ndarray) – True target values (log space) shape (n_samples, n_endpoints).

  • y_pred (np.ndarray) – Predicted target values (log space) shape matching y_true.

  • mask (np.ndarray) – Validity mask (integer or boolean) matching y_true shape.

  • endpoints (Sequence[str]) – Endpoint names corresponding to columns.

Returns:

Mapping endpoint -> {“log”: metrics, “linear”: metrics} including “macro”.

Return type:

dict[str, EndpointSpaceMetrics]

Ensemble evaluation helpers¶

Ensemble evaluation helpers for labeled and blind CSVs.

This module provides helpers to:

  • Load serialized models from directories (XGBoostMultiEndpoint supported by model config inference),

  • Convert SMILES to features expected by models (fingerprints / SMILES),

  • Run per-model predictions across an array of inputs,

  • Aggregate predictions across models (mean/median),

  • Provide simple helpers to produce standardized prediction DataFrames and metric tables compatible with the existing evaluation pipeline.

The module intentionally avoids direct plotting / CLI binding so it can be unit-tested easily. Visualizations and CLI integration live in separate modules. Where applicable, existing conversion functions from admet.evaluate.metrics and admet.visualize.model_performance are reused for parity with the project’s conventions.

class admet.evaluate.ensemble.EnsemblePredictConfig(models_root, eval_csv=None, blind_csv=None, agg_fn='mean', n_jobs=1, fingerprint_config=FingerprintConfig(radius=2, n_bits=1024, use_counts=True, include_chirality=False), train_data_root=None)[source]

Bases: object

Configuration for running ensemble predictions from a parent directory.

Parameters:

  • models_root (Path) – Parent directory under which individual model run directories live. Each run directory must contain a run_meta.json file written by the training pipeline, or a legacy config.json for older XGBoost-only runs.

  • eval_csv (Optional[Path]) – Optional path to a labeled evaluation CSV.

  • blind_csv (Optional[Path]) – Optional path to a blind (unlabeled) CSV.

  • agg_fn (str) – Aggregation function to combine per-model predictions.

  • n_jobs (int) – Level of parallelism across models when running predictions.

  • train_data_root (Optional[Path]) – Optional path to the Hugging Face datasets used during training. When provided, train/validation/test splits are evaluated and returned in the summary.

  • fingerprint_config (FingerprintConfig)

agg_fn: str = 'mean'
blind_csv: Optional[Path] = None
eval_csv: Optional[Path] = None
fingerprint_config: FingerprintConfig = FingerprintConfig(radius=2, n_bits=1024, use_counts=True, include_chirality=False)
models_root: Path
n_jobs: int = 1
train_data_root: Optional[Path] = None

admet.evaluate.ensemble.aggregate_predictions(per_model_preds, agg_fn='mean')[source]

Aggregate per-model predictions into an ensemble prediction.

Parameters:

  • per_model_preds (np.ndarray) – Array of shape (n_models, N, D).

  • agg_fn (str) – Aggregation function name (“mean” or “median”).

Returns:

Array of shape (N, D) with aggregated predictions in log10 space.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

admet.evaluate.ensemble.discover_model_runs(models_root)[source]

Discover model run directories beneath models_root.

Preference is given to directories containing run_meta.json written by the trainers. For backward compatibility we also support legacy XGBoost runs where only a config.json is present.

Return type:

List[Path]

Parameters:

models_root (Path)

admet.evaluate.ensemble.evaluate_blind_dataset(models, df_blind, endpoints, agg_fn='mean', n_jobs=1, fingerprint_config=None)[source]

Run ensemble inference on a blind (unlabeled) dataset.

Parameters:

  • models (List[BaseModel]) – Sequence of models (must share same endpoints ordering and n_endpoints).

  • df_blind (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame containing at least “Molecule Name” and “SMILES” columns.

  • endpoints (Sequence[str]) – Ordered list of endpoint names corresponding to model outputs.

  • agg_fn (str) – Aggregation function to combine per-model predictions (“mean” or “median”).

  • n_jobs (int) – Level of parallelism across models when running predictions.

  • fingerprint_config (FingerprintConfig | None)

Returns:

Tuple of (ens_preds_log_df, ens_preds_lin_df)

Return type:

Tuple[pandas.DataFrame, pandas.DataFrame]

admet.evaluate.ensemble.evaluate_labeled_dataset(models, df_eval, endpoints, agg_fn='mean', n_jobs=1, fingerprint_config=None)[source]

Run ensemble evaluation for a labeled dataset.

Parameters:

  • models (List[BaseModel]) – Sequence of models (must share same endpoints ordering and n_endpoints).

  • df_eval (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame containing at least “Molecule Name”, “SMILES” and endpoint columns with true target values in log10 space.

  • endpoints (Sequence[str]) – Ordered list of endpoint names corresponding to model outputs.

  • agg_fn (str) – Aggregation function to combine per-model predictions (“mean” or “median”).

  • n_jobs (int) – Level of parallelism across models when running predictions.

  • fingerprint_config (FingerprintConfig | None)

Returns:

Tuple of (ens_preds_log_df, ens_preds_lin_df, metrics_log_df, metrics_lin_df).

Return type:

Tuple[pandas.DataFrame, pandas.DataFrame, pandas.DataFrame, pandas.DataFrame]

admet.evaluate.ensemble.load_model_from_dir(model_dir)[source]

Load a model implementing the BaseModel interface from a model directory.

The loader attempts to infer the model type and instantiate the corresponding implementation. At present we support the XGBoostMultiEndpoint wrapper.

Return type:

BaseModel

Parameters:

model_dir (Path)

admet.evaluate.ensemble.load_models(model_dirs)[source]

Load multiple models from directories.

Parameters:

model_dirs (Sequence[str]) – Iterable of model directory paths.

Returns:

List of instantiated models.

Return type:

List[BaseModel]

DataFrame

admet.evaluate.ensemble.predict_per_model(models, smiles, n_jobs=1, fingerprint_config=None)[source]

Run predictions for each model on provided SMILES strings.

Parameters:

  • models (List[BaseModel]) – Sequence of models (must share same endpoints ordering and D).

  • smiles (pandas.Series) – Series of SMILES values aligned to prediction rows.

  • n_jobs (int)

  • fingerprint_config (FingerprintConfig | None)

Returns:

3-D array of shape (n_models, n_samples, n_endpoints)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

admet.evaluate.ensemble.predictions_to_dataframe(df_input, arr_ens_preds, endpoints)[source]

Build a standardized predictions DataFrame containing per-model and ensemble predictions for all endpoints

The returned DataFrame contains at least: Molecule Name, SMILES and for each endpoint: ensemble prediction

Return type:

DataFrame

Parameters:

  • df_input (DataFrame)

  • arr_ens_preds (ndarray)

  • endpoints (Sequence[str])

admet.evaluate.ensemble.run_ensemble_predictions_from_root(config, df_eval=None, df_blind=None)[source]

High-level API to run ensemble predictions from a parent directory.

This mirrors the training API style by accepting a configuration object and returning a summary of all relevant outputs.

Parameters:

  • config (EnsemblePredictConfig) – Configuration for the ensemble prediction run.

  • df_eval (Optional[pandas.DataFrame]) – Optional labeled evaluation DataFrame.

  • df_blind (Optional[pandas.DataFrame]) – Optional blind (unlabeled) DataFrame.

Returns:

Summary of ensemble prediction outputs.

Return type:

EnsemblePredictSummary
